comments.commentBody:
I wrote a heartfelt comment a few hours ago that somehow did not make it in so I will try again.

Amy you will live on. In your children's eyes, In Jason's heart, you may not get your 24 years traveling with him but your spirit will remain forever with them.

If Jason does get in to another relationship that woman will embrace you as well - how could she not? As great as he sounds it is your marriage - a marriage as a marriage SHOULD be - supporting each other that will continue on - that cannot be replaced. Jason sounds terrific because we are seeing him through your loving eyes.

Ovarian Cancer continues to take too many too young - it was my thesis at Yale and now 21 years later we have made little progress. I am so sorry for your pain. I am so sorry for Jason, Justin, Miles and Paris' pain and I wish you all peace. I know you all have love.

You're right about the thesis but wrong about everything else. Just remember to follow your own specious and dangerous advice not to get a screening pelvic ultrasound....wait until you are constipated and have nonspecific abdominal pain and  have a belly full of fluid. It's country doctors like you who are not familiar with the great strides in cancer screening since your "thesis" was composed years ago. And by the way every physician knows that as soon as they start working at a university hospital you are automatically an assistant professor ...it is no great achievement or honor. Women.....get screened !!!

This is really a response to Richard MD Nyc :

You could have easily put forward your different view point from that of Cat London MD regarding the value of women getting ultrasound pelvic scanning for early detection of pelvic and ovarian cancer without sounding so mean!

What does Cat London being a "small city" physician or becoming an "automatic assistant professor" by working at a teaching hospital have anything to do with your validating of a useful screening procedure?

I get you are also a Medical doctor, by the MD attached to your name. Your profession requires compassion, calmness, objectivity, patience... just to name a few qualities I would pray to see in a medical professional if and when I or my loved ones are in need of medical care : not the kind of attitude you have shown here, i. e. trying to put down another in the same profession in a most vicious way simply because his /her opinion is different from that of yours.

The screening may be really helpful to detect these diseases early and to save lives - many more women would have heed your advice and be truly grateful to you for that too, if you manage to deliver it without that belicose rant about another person 's different view. You know, "disagreeing, without being disagreeable" and all that... Especially after reading such a heart warming poignant essay by AKR, filled with all the positive qualities of humanity.

Just saying.

Symptomatic women vey different than the global screening you first commented about - you called for all women asking for an ultrasound. If a woman came in with vague symptoms that is a different scenario. Ovarian cancer presents with vague symptoms - however I highly doubt it will be stage I as you suggest in your global screening strategy. By the time a woman has constipation, bloating etc it is everywhere - just like when I wrote a thesis 22 years ago. Unfortunately we have not made much headway in ovarian cancer. A diagnostic study is not a screening test - you may wish to learn the difference in terminology big city doctor.

FYI, universities assign Clinical Instructor automatically - sorry. I earned my title having been one.

Evidence based medicine matters.

"100% untrue"?

Now everybody is living in fantasy land.
So how exactly will we know when Trump has Really Lost It?

I'm sorry, but I find the "no evidence" headline to be hypocritical. There have been countless stories in the press about Russian links to the Trump administration, and there has been no evidence offered either. Most of the stories are based on anonymous sources from inside the government and from the former administration. There is no way for the public to judge the credibility of those sources, to understand their motivations, or to determine whether the information is full and complete. There needs to be a full airing of information, from both the current administration and the press.

A predictable effort to deflect media attention from the boiling Trump-Russia controversy.   The sheer desperation of the tweet is evidence that the media should remain intensely focused on the Russia story and NOT be diverted.
The USA has elected the Breibart comments page as President.

You just can't make this stuff up.  Trump just doesn't learn.  He got widespread praise from all sides of the isle for his congressional speech.  People were starting to warm up to him because they saw that he could be presidential.  Then, he erroneously accuses one of the most popular presidents in modern history of committing an illegal act based on an article he read on Breitbart.  As if him making false claims due to him watching Fox News wasn't enough.  Let's be real here, this is a sad attempt to distract the public from the numerous issues going on within his administration.  This accusation shouldn't be given the time of day unless real evidence is provided.
Mr. Trump is dangerous.  Congress needs to act to get this man out of office.
Offering no evidence, from Trump, means lying.
So he's not only classically diagnosably arcissistic, he's also paranoid?
No proof, but millions will believe him and take up the cry.  This is how Trump uses lies and fake news to further himself, and his minions are following suit.
He's already got America's most respected journalist, Geraldo Rivera, taking up his case.  No need to put out "fake news" when Geraldo's got your back.
At what point can #44 sue #45 for libel?
I think he could right now and I wish he would !

The long, miserable slog of an ineffective and divisive affirmative action policy is merely the price we pay for refusing to grant dignity to millions of Americans because of their race. Ten grand appears to let us off the hook too easily. Why not give them something of equal value, like a ten-year-old Toyota, or maybe forty acres and a mule?

Then again, we could keep the money and just stop shooting black people at traffic stops, a crime which has seemingly skyrocketed ever since the invention of the cell phone camera.

Maybe we could invest those billions into refurbishing inner city schools, and paying public school teachers a living wage. Or perhaps all the cities that have faced economic abandonment for the past fifty years could use the money to make them look less like a Serbian war zone, and more conducive to raising children without fear of them getting shot.

It would take away funds from the president’s promised wall, but we might find a way to live without it. Besides, he’s making America safe by deporting mothers and fathers, breaking up families and causing pointless grief and misery.

There are lots of things that divide us as much as racism. So as long as we’re making silly proposals, how about giving ten grand to every person who voted for the president? If anyone needs help, they do.

4000 people were shot in Chicago, 26 by police, and traffic stops worry you?  Yeah, hold the trained authorities to a higher standard (read Larger Catechism on what makes sins worse).  Yeah, a church bro of mine has been stopped 3x for driving while black.  But worry about black-on-black wickedness, too, OK?

@ gemli - gemli your text makes a good supplement to my comment just submitted at 2 AM your time today 3/5 in which I present scholars' proposal to end classification by "race" and parallel with that introduce policies some of which you propose.
Only-NeverInSweden.blogspot.com
Wow I think you watch too much TV, blacks aren't being killed at traffic stops at an alarming rate.

For all those commenters fawning on Trump after his address to congress this week as a "statesman" and "finally presidential", looks like (as most of us knew) that was a blip. He is, as ever, erratic, unhinged, paranoid, uninformed and still unfit for the office.
The president is immune from such litigation while in office.
Tuesday night is beginning to look like the calm before the storm.
Interestingly, Obama in his reply to Trump's accusations didn't say there was no wiretapping of the Trump Tower.
Put up the proof or shut up. More lies from Trump and their tint hat supporters.
And why should he? If the Justice Department (FBI) is running an investigation of Trump's ties to Russia and campaign influence, that's not something for public consumption. Yet.
Nor did Obama mention tin foil hats, either.

This is starting to sound like the Sessions statement that he had not met with Russians when he had not been asked that. How much do you want to bet that there were seriously compromising conversations taking place then? These guys need to learn the wisdom of an Italian saying: you missed an excellent opportunity to keep quiet.

He's never been in control so saying he's out of control doesn't quite fit.
The astounding part is that roughly half of the Country believes he's doing a great job, and half of the Country believes he needs to be institutionalized.
One side or the other is almost certainly correct.
I'll bet this has nothing whatsoever to do with real or imaginary wire-tapping; more likely, it's yet another smokescreen designed to get the press' - and our - attention away from the Russia issue.
If there really were a "deep state," Trump would not be president.
It was the job of President Obama, while President, to protect the nation from all enemies, foreign and domestic. If true, he was certainly within his rights to do so.
I never thought that we would have a President that would make Nixon look sane and W look like an intellectual, all at the same time.
I miss George W SO MUCH!
And even Bo, Obama's poodle, knew better than to crap all over the constitution.

The paranoid Nixon will never look sane, and W will never be close to being an intellectual...far from it....more like "Jack Jack the idiot dunce" who was nothing but a legacy pawn for the Neocons. Trump is not stupid or uneducated but he is unprepared for this position and lacks the necessary discipline and dignity for the job. It's not relative, they were & are all poisonus and very  deeply flawed & destructive men.
Don't worry -- the media can focus on more than one thing at a time -- they've been doing a pretty good job of it lately.
"You see it was the strawberries,the crew hid the strawberries"Humphrey Bogart,Caine Mutiny.
